57// Get the CPU features enabled by the build.
58static unsigned CpuFeaturesImpliedByCompiler() {
59 unsigned answer = 0;
60 return answer;
61}
62
63static bool supportsCPUFeature(const char* feature) {
64 static std::set<std::string>& features = *new std::set<std::string>();
65 static std::set<std::string>& all_available_features =
66 *new std::set<std::string>({"iesan3", "zarch", "stfle", "msa", "ldisp",
67 "eimm", "dfp", "etf3eh", "highgprs", "te",
68 "vx"});
69 if (features.empty()) {
70#if V8_HOST_ARCH_S390
71
72#ifndef HWCAP_S390_VX
73#define HWCAP_S390_VX 2048
74#endif
75#define CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(mask, value) \
76 if (f & mask) features.insert(value);
77
78 // initialize feature vector
79 uint64_t f = getauxval(AT_HWCAP);
80 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_ESAN3, "iesan3")
81 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_ZARCH, "zarch")
82 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_STFLE, "stfle")
83 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_MSA, "msa")
84 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_LDISP, "ldisp")
85 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_EIMM, "eimm")
86 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_DFP, "dfp")
87 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_ETF3EH, "etf3eh")
88 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_HIGH_GPRS, "highgprs")
89 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_TE, "te")
90 CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR(HWCAP_S390_VX, "vx")
91#else
92 // import all features
93 features.insert(all_available_features.begin(),
94 all_available_features.end());
95#endif
96 }
97 USE(all_available_features);
98 return features.find(feature) != features.end();
99}
100
101#undef CHECK_AVAILABILITY_FOR
102#undef HWCAP_S390_VX
103
104// Check whether Store Facility STFLE instruction is available on the platform.
105// Instruction returns a bit vector of the enabled hardware facilities.
106static bool supportsSTFLE() {
107#if V8_HOST_ARCH_S390
108 static bool read_tried = false;
109 static uint32_t auxv_hwcap = 0;
110
111 if (!read_tried) {
112 // Open the AUXV (auxiliary vector) pseudo-file
113 int fd = open("/proc/self/auxv", O_RDONLY);
114
115 read_tried = true;
116 if (fd != -1) {
117#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_S390X
118 static Elf64_auxv_t buffer[16];
119 Elf64_auxv_t* auxv_element;
120#else
121 static Elf32_auxv_t buffer[16];
122 Elf32_auxv_t* auxv_element;
123#endif
124 int bytes_read = 0;
125 while (bytes_read >= 0) {
126 // Read a chunk of the AUXV
127 bytes_read = read(fd, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
128 // Locate and read the platform field of AUXV if it is in the chunk
129 for (auxv_element = buffer;
130 auxv_element + sizeof(auxv_element) <= buffer + bytes_read &&
131 auxv_element->a_type != AT_NULL;
132 auxv_element++) {
133 // We are looking for HWCAP entry in AUXV to search for STFLE support
134 if (auxv_element->a_type == AT_HWCAP) {
135 /* Note: Both auxv_hwcap and buffer are static */
136 auxv_hwcap = auxv_element->a_un.a_val;
137 goto done_reading;
138 }
139 }
140 }
141 done_reading:
142 close(fd);
143 }
144 }
145
146 // Did not find result
147 if (0 == auxv_hwcap) {
148 return false;
149 }
150
151 // HWCAP_S390_STFLE is defined to be 4 in include/asm/elf.h. Currently
152 // hardcoded in case that include file does not exist.
153 const uint32_t _HWCAP_S390_STFLE = 4;
154 return (auxv_hwcap & _HWCAP_S390_STFLE);
155#else
156 // STFLE is not available on non-s390 hosts
157 return false;
158#endif
159}
160
161bool CpuFeatures::SupportsWasmSimd128() {
162#if V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
163 return CpuFeatures::IsSupported(VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_1);
164#else
165 return false;
166#endif // V8_ENABLE_WEBASSEMBLY
167}
168
169void CpuFeatures::ProbeImpl(bool cross_compile) {
170 supported_ |= CpuFeaturesImpliedByCompiler();
171 icache_line_size_ = 256;
172
173 // Only use statically determined features for cross compile (snapshot).
174 if (cross_compile) return;
175
176#ifdef DEBUG
177 initialized_ = true;
178#endif
179
180 static bool performSTFLE = supportsSTFLE();
181
182// Need to define host, as we are generating inlined S390 assembly to test
183// for facilities.
184#if V8_HOST_ARCH_S390
185 if (performSTFLE) {
186 // STFLE D(B) requires:
187 // GPR0 to specify # of double words to update minus 1.
188 // i.e. GPR0 = 0 for 1 doubleword
189 // D(B) to specify to memory location to store the facilities bits
190 // The facilities we are checking for are:
191 // Bit 45 - Distinct Operands for instructions like ARK, SRK, etc.
192 // As such, we require only 1 double word
193 int64_t facilities[3] = {0L};
194 int16_t reg0;
195 // LHI sets up GPR0
196 // STFLE is specified as .insn, as opcode is not recognized.
197 // We register the instructions kill r0 (LHI) and the CC (STFLE).
198 asm volatile(
199 "lhi %%r0,2\n"
200 ".insn s,0xb2b00000,%0\n"
201 : "=Q"(facilities), "=r"(reg0)
202 :
203 : "cc", "r0");
204
205 uint64_t one = static_cast<uint64_t>(1);
206 // Test for Distinct Operands Facility - Bit 45
207 if (facilities[0] & (one << (63 - 45))) {
208 supported_ |= (1u << DISTINCT_OPS);
209 }
210 // Test for General Instruction Extension Facility - Bit 34
211 if (facilities[0] & (one << (63 - 34))) {
212 supported_ |= (1u << GENERAL_INSTR_EXT);
213 }
214 // Test for Floating Point Extension Facility - Bit 37
215 if (facilities[0] & (one << (63 - 37))) {
216 supported_ |= (1u << FLOATING_POINT_EXT);
217 }
218 // Test for Vector Facility - Bit 129
219 if (facilities[2] & (one << (63 - (129 - 128))) &&
220 supportsCPUFeature("vx")) {
221 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_FACILITY);
222 }
223 // Test for Vector Enhancement Facility 1 - Bit 135
224 if (facilities[2] & (one << (63 - (135 - 128))) &&
225 supportsCPUFeature("vx")) {
226 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_1);
227 }
228 // Test for Vector Enhancement Facility 2 - Bit 148
229 if (facilities[2] & (one << (63 - (148 - 128))) &&
230 supportsCPUFeature("vx")) {
231 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_2);
232 }
233 // Test for Miscellaneous Instruction Extension Facility - Bit 58
234 if (facilities[0] & (1lu << (63 - 58))) {
235 supported_ |= (1u << MISC_INSTR_EXT2);
236 }
237 }
238#else
239 // All distinct ops instructions can be simulated
240 supported_ |= (1u << DISTINCT_OPS);
241 // RISBG can be simulated
242 supported_ |= (1u << GENERAL_INSTR_EXT);
243 supported_ |= (1u << FLOATING_POINT_EXT);
244 supported_ |= (1u << MISC_INSTR_EXT2);
245 USE(performSTFLE); // To avoid assert
246 USE(supportsCPUFeature);
247 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_FACILITY);
248 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_1);
249 supported_ |= (1u << VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_2);
250#endif
251 supported_ |= (1u << FPU);
252
253 // Set a static value on whether Simd is supported.
254 // This variable is only used for certain archs to query SupportWasmSimd128()
255 // at runtime in builtins using an extern ref. Other callers should use
256 // CpuFeatures::SupportWasmSimd128().
257 CpuFeatures::supports_wasm_simd_128_ = CpuFeatures::SupportsWasmSimd128();
258}
259
260void CpuFeatures::PrintTarget() {
261 const char* s390_arch = nullptr;
262
263#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_S390X
264 s390_arch = "s390x";
265#else
266 s390_arch = "s390";
267#endif
268
269 PrintF("target %s\n", s390_arch);
270}
271
272void CpuFeatures::PrintFeatures() {
273 PrintF("FPU=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(FPU));
274 PrintF("FPU_EXT=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(FLOATING_POINT_EXT));
275 PrintF("GENERAL_INSTR=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(GENERAL_INSTR_EXT));
276 PrintF("DISTINCT_OPS=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(DISTINCT_OPS));
277 PrintF("VECTOR_FACILITY=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(VECTOR_FACILITY));
278 PrintF("VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_1=%d\n",
279 CpuFeatures::IsSupported(VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_1));
280 PrintF("VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_2=%d\n",
281 CpuFeatures::IsSupported(VECTOR_ENHANCE_FACILITY_2));
282 PrintF("MISC_INSTR_EXT2=%d\n", CpuFeatures::IsSupported(MISC_INSTR_EXT2));
283}
284
285Register ToRegister(int num) {
286 DCHECK(num >= 0 && num < kNumRegisters);
287 const Register kRegisters[] = {r0, r1, r2, r3, r4, r5, r6, r7,
288 r8, r9, r10, fp, ip, r13, r14, sp};
289 return kRegisters[num];
290}
291
292// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
293// Implementation of RelocInfo
294
295const int RelocInfo::kApplyMask =
296 RelocInfo::ModeMask(RelocInfo::CODE_TARGET) |
297 RelocInfo::ModeMask(RelocInfo::INTERNAL_REFERENCE);
298
299bool RelocInfo::IsCodedSpecially() {
300 // The deserializer needs to know whether a pointer is specially
301 // coded. Being specially coded on S390 means that it is an iihf/iilf
302 // instruction sequence, and that is always the case inside code
303 // objects.
304 return true;
305}
306
307bool RelocInfo::IsInConstantPool() { return false; }
308
309uint32_t RelocInfo::wasm_call_tag() const {
310 DCHECK(rmode_ == WASM_CALL || rmode_ == WASM_STUB_CALL);
311 return static_cast<uint32_t>(
312 Assembler::target_address_at(pc_, constant_pool_));
313}
314
315// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
316// Implementation of Operand and MemOperand
317// See assembler-s390-inl.h for inlined constructors
318
319Operand::Operand(Handle<HeapObject> handle) {
320 AllowHandleDereference using_location;
321 rm_ = no_reg;
322 value_.immediate = static_cast<intptr_t>(handle.address());
323 rmode_ = RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT;
324}
325
326Operand Operand::EmbeddedNumber(double value) {
327 int32_t smi;
328 if (DoubleToSmiInteger(value, &smi)) return Operand(Smi::FromInt(smi));
329 Operand result(0, RelocInfo::FULL_EMBEDDED_OBJECT);
330 result.is_heap_number_request_ = true;
331 result.value_.heap_number_request = HeapNumberRequest(value);
332 return result;
333}
334
335MemOperand::MemOperand(Register rn, int32_t offset)
336 : baseRegister(rn), indexRegister(r0), offset_(offset) {}
337
338MemOperand::MemOperand(Register rx, Register rb, int32_t offset)
339 : baseRegister(rb), indexRegister(rx), offset_(offset) {}
340
341void Assembler::AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapNumbers(LocalIsolate* isolate) {
342 DCHECK_IMPLIES(isolate == nullptr, heap_number_requests_.empty());
343 for (auto& request : heap_number_requests_) {
344 Address pc = reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_) + request.offset();
345 Handle<HeapObject> object =
346 isolate->factory()->NewHeapNumber<AllocationType::kOld>(
347 request.heap_number());
348 set_target_address_at(pc, kNullAddress, object.address(),
349 SKIP_ICACHE_FLUSH);
350 }
351}
352
353// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
354// Specific instructions, constants, and masks.
355
356Assembler::Assembler(const AssemblerOptions& options,
357 std::unique_ptr<AssemblerBuffer> buffer)
358 : AssemblerBase(options, std::move(buffer)), scratch_register_list_({ip}) {
359 reloc_info_writer.Reposition(buffer_start_ + buffer_->size(), pc_);
360 last_bound_pos_ = 0;
361 relocations_.reserve(128);
362}
363
364void Assembler::GetCode(Isolate* isolate, CodeDesc* desc) {
365 GetCode(isolate->main_thread_local_isolate(), desc);
366}
367void Assembler::GetCode(LocalIsolate* isolate, CodeDesc* desc,
368 SafepointTableBuilderBase* safepoint_table_builder,
369 int handler_table_offset) {
370 // As a crutch to avoid having to add manual Align calls wherever we use a
371 // raw workflow to create Code objects (mostly in tests), add another Align
372 // call here. It does no harm - the end of the Code object is aligned to the
373 // (larger) kCodeAlignment anyways.
374 // TODO(jgruber): Consider moving responsibility for proper alignment to
375 // metadata table builders (safepoint, handler, constant pool, code
376 // comments).
377 DataAlign(InstructionStream::kMetadataAlignment);
378
379 EmitRelocations();
380
381 int code_comments_size = WriteCodeComments();
382
383 AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapNumbers(isolate);
384
385 // Set up code descriptor.
386 // TODO(jgruber): Reconsider how these offsets and sizes are maintained up to
387 // this point to make CodeDesc initialization less fiddly.
388
389 static constexpr int kConstantPoolSize = 0;
390 const int instruction_size = pc_offset();
391 const int code_comments_offset = instruction_size - code_comments_size;
392 const int constant_pool_offset = code_comments_offset - kConstantPoolSize;
393 const int handler_table_offset2 = (handler_table_offset == kNoHandlerTable)
394 ? constant_pool_offset
395 : handler_table_offset;
396 const int safepoint_table_offset =
397 (safepoint_table_builder == kNoSafepointTable)
398 ? handler_table_offset2
399 : safepoint_table_builder->safepoint_table_offset();
400 const int reloc_info_offset =
401 static_cast<int>(reloc_info_writer.pos() - buffer_->start());
402 CodeDesc::Initialize(desc, this, safepoint_table_offset,
403 handler_table_offset2, constant_pool_offset,
404 code_comments_offset, reloc_info_offset);
405}
406
407void Assembler::Align(int m) {
408 DCHECK(m >= 4 && base::bits::IsPowerOfTwo(m));
409 while ((pc_offset() & (m - 1)) != 0) {
410 nop(0);
411 }
412}
413
414void Assembler::CodeTargetAlign() { Align(8); }
415
416Condition Assembler::GetCondition(Instr instr) {
417 switch (instr & kCondMask) {
418 case BT:
419 return eq;
420 case BF:
421 return ne;
422 default:
423 UNIMPLEMENTED();
424 }
425}
426
427#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_S390X
428// This code assumes a FIXED_SEQUENCE for 64bit loads (iihf/iilf)
429bool Assembler::Is64BitLoadIntoIP(SixByteInstr instr1, SixByteInstr instr2) {
430 // Check the instructions are the iihf/iilf load into ip
431 return (((instr1 >> 32) == 0xC0C8) && ((instr2 >> 32) == 0xC0C9));
432}
433#else
434// This code assumes a FIXED_SEQUENCE for 32bit loads (iilf)
435bool Assembler::Is32BitLoadIntoIP(SixByteInstr instr) {
436 // Check the instruction is an iilf load into ip/r12.
437 return ((instr >> 32) == 0xC0C9);
438}
439#endif
440
441// Labels refer to positions in the (to be) generated code.
442// There are bound, linked, and unused labels.
443//
444// Bound labels refer to known positions in the already
445// generated code. pos() is the position the label refers to.
446//
447// Linked labels refer to unknown positions in the code
448// to be generated; pos() is the position of the last
449// instruction using the label.
450
451// The link chain is terminated by a negative code position (must be aligned)
452const int kEndOfChain = -4;
453
454// Returns the target address of the relative instructions, typically
455// of the form: pos + imm (where immediate is in # of halfwords for
456// BR* and LARL).
457int Assembler::target_at(int pos) {
458 SixByteInstr instr = instr_at(pos);
459 // check which type of branch this is 16 or 26 bit offset
460 Opcode opcode = Instruction::S390OpcodeValue(buffer_start_ + pos);
461
462 if (BRC == opcode || BRCT == opcode || BRCTG == opcode || BRXH == opcode) {
463 int16_t imm16 = SIGN_EXT_IMM16((instr & kImm16Mask));
464 imm16 <<= 1; // immediate is in # of halfwords
465 if (imm16 == 0) return kEndOfChain;
466 return pos + imm16;
467 } else if (LLILF == opcode || BRCL == opcode || LARL == opcode ||
468 BRASL == opcode || LGRL == opcode) {
469 int32_t imm32 =
470 static_cast<int32_t>(instr & (static_cast<uint64_t>(0xFFFFFFFF)));
471 if (LLILF != opcode)
472 imm32 <<= 1; // BR* + LARL treat immediate in # of halfwords
473 if (imm32 == 0) return kEndOfChain;
474 return pos + imm32;
475 } else if (BRXHG == opcode) {
476 // offset is in bits 16-31 of 48 bit instruction
477 instr = instr >> 16;
478 int16_t imm16 = SIGN_EXT_IMM16((instr & kImm16Mask));
479 imm16 <<= 1; // immediate is in # of halfwords
480 if (imm16 == 0) return kEndOfChain;
481 return pos + imm16;
482 }
483
484 // Unknown condition
485 DCHECK(false);
486 return -1;
487}
488
489// Update the target address of the current relative instruction.
490void Assembler::target_at_put(int pos, int target_pos, bool* is_branch) {
491 SixByteInstr instr = instr_at(pos);
492 Opcode opcode = Instruction::S390OpcodeValue(buffer_start_ + pos);
493
494 if (is_branch != nullptr) {
495 *is_branch =
496 (opcode == BRC || opcode == BRCT || opcode == BRCTG || opcode == BRCL ||
497 opcode == BRASL || opcode == BRXH || opcode == BRXHG);
498 }
499
500 if (BRC == opcode || BRCT == opcode || BRCTG == opcode || BRXH == opcode) {
501 int16_t imm16 = target_pos - pos;
502 instr &= (~0xFFFF);
503 DCHECK(is_int16(imm16));
504 instr_at_put<FourByteInstr>(pos, instr | (imm16 >> 1));
505 return;
506 } else if (BRCL == opcode || LARL == opcode || BRASL == opcode ||
507 LGRL == opcode) {
508 // Immediate is in # of halfwords
509 int32_t imm32 = target_pos - pos;
510 instr &= (~static_cast<uint64_t>(0xFFFFFFFF));
511 instr_at_put<SixByteInstr>(pos, instr | (imm32 >> 1));
512 return;
513 } else if (LLILF == opcode) {
514 DCHECK(target_pos == kEndOfChain || target_pos >= 0);
515 // Emitted label constant, not part of a branch.
516 // Make label relative to InstructionStream pointer of generated
517 // InstructionStream object.
518 int32_t imm32 =
519 target_pos + (InstructionStream::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag);
520 instr &= (~static_cast<uint64_t>(0xFFFFFFFF));
521 instr_at_put<SixByteInstr>(pos, instr | imm32);
522 return;
523 } else if (BRXHG == opcode) {
524 // Immediate is in bits 16-31 of 48 bit instruction
525 int32_t imm16 = target_pos - pos;
526 instr &= (0xFFFF0000FFFF); // clear bits 16-31
527 imm16 &= 0xFFFF; // clear high halfword
528 imm16 <<= 16;
529 // Immediate is in # of halfwords
530 instr_at_put<SixByteInstr>(pos, instr | (imm16 >> 1));
531 return;
532 }
533 DCHECK(false);
534}
535
536// Returns the maximum number of bits given instruction can address.
537int Assembler::max_reach_from(int pos) {
538 Opcode opcode = Instruction::S390OpcodeValue(buffer_start_ + pos);
539 // Check which type of instr. In theory, we can return
540 // the values below + 1, given offset is # of halfwords
541 if (BRC == opcode || BRCT == opcode || BRCTG == opcode || BRXH == opcode ||
542 BRXHG == opcode) {
543 return 16;
544 } else if (LLILF == opcode || BRCL == opcode || LARL == opcode ||
545 BRASL == opcode || LGRL == opcode) {
546 return 31; // Using 31 as workaround instead of 32 as
547 // is_intn(x,32) doesn't work on 32-bit platforms.
548 // llilf: Emitted label constant, not part of
549 // a branch (regexp PushBacktrack).
550 }
551 DCHECK(false);
552 return 16;
553}
554
555void Assembler::bind_to(Label* L, int pos) {
556 DCHECK(0 <= pos && pos <= pc_offset()); // must have a valid binding position
557 bool is_branch = false;
558 while (L->is_linked()) {
559 int fixup_pos = L->pos();
560#ifdef DEBUG
561 int32_t offset = pos - fixup_pos;
562 int maxReach = max_reach_from(fixup_pos);
563#endif
564 next(L); // call next before overwriting link with target at fixup_pos
565 DCHECK(is_intn(offset, maxReach));
566 target_at_put(fixup_pos, pos, &is_branch);
567 }
568 L->bind_to(pos);
569
570 // Keep track of the last bound label so we don't eliminate any instructions
571 // before a bound label.
572 if (pos > last_bound_pos_) last_bound_pos_ = pos;
573}
574
575void Assembler::bind(Label* L) {
576 DCHECK(!L->is_bound()); // label can only be bound once
577 bind_to(L, pc_offset());
578}
579
580void Assembler::next(Label* L) {
581 DCHECK(L->is_linked());
582 int link = target_at(L->pos());
583 if (link == kEndOfChain) {
584 L->Unuse();
585 } else {
586 DCHECK_GE(link, 0);
587 L->link_to(link);
588 }
589}
590
591int Assembler::link(Label* L) {
592 int position;
593 if (L->is_bound()) {
594 position = L->pos();
595 } else {
596 if (L->is_linked()) {
597 position = L->pos(); // L's link
598 } else {
599 // was: target_pos = kEndOfChain;
600 // However, using self to mark the first reference
601 // should avoid most instances of branch offset overflow. See
602 // target_at() for where this is converted back to kEndOfChain.
603 position = pc_offset();
604 }
605 L->link_to(pc_offset());
606 }
607
608 return position;
609}
610
611void Assembler::load_label_offset(Register r1, Label* L) {
612 int target_pos;
613 int constant;
614 if (L->is_bound()) {
615 target_pos = L->pos();
616 constant = target_pos + (InstructionStream::kHeaderSize - kHeapObjectTag);
617 } else {
618 if (L->is_linked()) {
619 target_pos = L->pos(); // L's link
620 } else {
621 // was: target_pos = kEndOfChain;
622 // However, using branch to self to mark the first reference
623 // should avoid most instances of branch offset overflow. See
624 // target_at() for where this is converted back to kEndOfChain.
625 target_pos = pc_offset();
626 }
627 L->link_to(pc_offset());
628
629 constant = target_pos - pc_offset();
630 }
631 llilf(r1, Operand(constant));
632}
633
634// Pseudo op - branch on condition
635void Assembler::branchOnCond(Condition c, int branch_offset, bool is_bound,
636 bool force_long_branch) {
637 int offset_in_halfwords = branch_offset / 2;
638 if (is_bound && is_int16(offset_in_halfwords) && !force_long_branch) {
639 brc(c, Operand(offset_in_halfwords)); // short jump
640 } else {
641 brcl(c, Operand(offset_in_halfwords)); // long jump
642 }
643}
644
645// Exception-generating instructions and debugging support.
646// Stops with a non-negative code less than kNumOfWatchedStops support
647// enabling/disabling and a counter feature. See simulator-s390.h .
648void Assembler::stop(Condition cond, int32_t code, CRegister cr) {
649 if (cond != al) {
650 Label skip;
651 b(NegateCondition(cond), &skip, Label::kNear);
652 bkpt(0);
653 bind(&skip);
654 } else {
655 bkpt(0);
656 }
657}
658
659void Assembler::bkpt(uint32_t imm16) {
660 // GDB software breakpoint instruction
661 emit2bytes(0x0001);
662}
663
664// Pseudo instructions.
665void Assembler::nop(int type) {
666 switch (type) {
667 case 0:
668 lr(r0, r0);
669 break;
670 case DEBUG_BREAK_NOP:
671 // TODO(john.yan): Use a better NOP break
672 oill(r3, Operand::Zero());
673 break;
674 default:
675 UNIMPLEMENTED();
676 }
677}
678
679// -------------------------
680// Load Address Instructions
681// -------------------------
682// Load Address Relative Long
683void Assembler::larl(Register r1, Label* l) {
684 larl(r1, Operand(branch_offset(l)));
685}
686
687void Assembler::lgrl(Register r1, Label* l) {
688 lgrl(r1, Operand(branch_offset(l)));
689}
690
691void Assembler::EnsureSpaceFor(int space_needed) {
692 if (buffer_space() <= (kGap + space_needed)) {
693 GrowBuffer(space_needed);
694 }
695}
696
697void Assembler::call(Handle<Code> target, RelocInfo::Mode rmode) {
698 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsCodeTarget(rmode));
699 EnsureSpace ensure_space(this);
700
701 RecordRelocInfo(rmode);
702 int32_t target_index = AddCodeTarget(target);
703 brasl(r14, Operand(target_index));
704}
705
706void Assembler::jump(Handle<Code> target, RelocInfo::Mode rmode,
707 Condition cond) {
708 DCHECK(RelocInfo::IsRelativeCodeTarget(rmode));
709 EnsureSpace ensure_space(this);
710
711 RecordRelocInfo(rmode);
712 int32_t target_index = AddCodeTarget(target);
713 brcl(cond, Operand(target_index));
714}
715
716// end of S390instructions
717
718bool Assembler::IsNop(SixByteInstr instr, int type) {
719 DCHECK((0 == type) || (DEBUG_BREAK_NOP == type));
720 if (DEBUG_BREAK_NOP == type) {
721 return ((instr & 0xFFFFFFFF) == 0xA53B0000); // oill r3, 0
722 }
723 return ((instr & 0xFFFF) == 0x1800); // lr r0,r0
724}
725
726// dummy instruction reserved for special use.
727void Assembler::dumy(int r1, int x2, int b2, int d2) {
728#if defined(USE_SIMULATOR)
729 int op = 0xE353;
730 uint64_t code = (static_cast<uint64_t>(op & 0xFF00)) * B32 |
731 (static_cast<uint64_t>(r1) & 0xF) * B36 |
732 (static_cast<uint64_t>(x2) & 0xF) * B32 |
733 (static_cast<uint64_t>(b2) & 0xF) * B28 |
734 (static_cast<uint64_t>(d2 & 0x0FFF)) * B16 |
735 (static_cast<uint64_t>(d2 & 0x0FF000)) >> 4 |
736 (static_cast<uint64_t>(op & 0x00FF));
737 emit6bytes(code);
738#endif
739}
740
741void Assembler::GrowBuffer(int needed) {
742 DCHECK_EQ(buffer_start_, buffer_->start());
743
744 // Compute new buffer size.
745 int old_size = buffer_->size();
746 int new_size = std::min(2 * old_size, old_size + 1 * MB);
747 int space = buffer_space() + (new_size - old_size);
748 new_size += (space < needed) ? needed - space : 0;
749
750 // Some internal data structures overflow for very large buffers,
751 // they must ensure that kMaximalBufferSize is not too large.
752 if (new_size > kMaximalBufferSize) {
753 V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(nullptr, "Assembler::GrowBuffer");
754 }
755
756 // Set up new buffer.
757 std::unique_ptr<AssemblerBuffer> new_buffer = buffer_->Grow(new_size);
758 DCHECK_EQ(new_size, new_buffer->size());
759 uint8_t* new_start = new_buffer->start();
760
761 // Copy the data.
762 intptr_t pc_delta = new_start - buffer_start_;
763 intptr_t rc_delta = (new_start + new_size) - (buffer_start_ + old_size);
764 size_t reloc_size = (buffer_start_ + old_size) - reloc_info_writer.pos();
765 MemMove(new_start, buffer_start_, pc_offset());
766 MemMove(reloc_info_writer.pos() + rc_delta, reloc_info_writer.pos(),
767 reloc_size);
768
769 // Switch buffers.
770 buffer_ = std::move(new_buffer);
771 buffer_start_ = new_start;
772 pc_ += pc_delta;
773 reloc_info_writer.Reposition(reloc_info_writer.pos() + rc_delta,
774 reloc_info_writer.last_pc() + pc_delta);
775
776 // None of our relocation types are pc relative pointing outside the code
777 // buffer nor pc absolute pointing inside the code buffer, so there is no need
778 // to relocate any emitted relocation entries.
779}
780
781void Assembler::db(uint8_t data) {
782 CheckBuffer();
783 *reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(pc_) = data;
784 pc_ += sizeof(uint8_t);
785}
786
787void Assembler::dd(uint32_t data) {
788 CheckBuffer();
789 *reinterpret_cast<uint32_t*>(pc_) = data;
790 pc_ += sizeof(uint32_t);
791}
792
793void Assembler::dq(uint64_t value) {
794 CheckBuffer();
795 *reinterpret_cast<uint64_t*>(pc_) = value;
796 pc_ += sizeof(uint64_t);
797}
798
799void Assembler::dp(uintptr_t data) {
800 CheckBuffer();
801 *reinterpret_cast<uintptr_t*>(pc_) = data;
802 pc_ += sizeof(uintptr_t);
803}
804
805void Assembler::RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::Mode rmode, intptr_t data) {
806 if (!ShouldRecordRelocInfo(rmode)) return;
807 DeferredRelocInfo rinfo(pc_offset(), rmode, data);
808 relocations_.push_back(rinfo);
809}
810
811void Assembler::emit_label_addr(Label* label) {
812 CheckBuffer();
813 RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::INTERNAL_REFERENCE);
814 int position = link(label);
815 DCHECK(label->is_bound());
816 // Keep internal references relative until EmitRelocations.
817 dp(position);
818}
819
820void Assembler::EmitRelocations() {
821 EnsureSpaceFor(relocations_.size() * kMaxRelocSize);
822
823 for (std::vector<DeferredRelocInfo>::iterator it = relocations_.begin();
824 it != relocations_.end(); it++) {
825 RelocInfo::Mode rmode = it->rmode();
826 Address pc = reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_) + it->position();
827 RelocInfo rinfo(pc, rmode, it->data());
828
829 // Fix up internal references now that they are guaranteed to be bound.
830 if (RelocInfo::IsInternalReference(rmode)) {
831 // Jump table entry
832 Address pos = Memory<Address>(pc);
833 Memory<Address>(pc) = reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_) + pos;
834 } else if (RelocInfo::IsInternalReferenceEncoded(rmode)) {
835 // mov sequence
836 Address pos = target_address_at(pc, 0);
837 set_target_address_at(pc, 0,
838 reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_) + pos,
839 SKIP_ICACHE_FLUSH);
840 }
841
842 reloc_info_writer.Write(&rinfo);
843 }
844}

846} // namespace internal

848#endif // V8_TARGET_ARCH_S390
